item.title: Returning Sequential Numbers With SQL Queries
item.description: In ad-hoc data analytics, I often find it useful to return a sequence number along with query results. Once of the easiest ways, if your database supports window functions, is to use the row_number() ranking function SELECT field_1, ..., field_n, row_number() OVER ( ORDER By order_by_field ) As seq FROM your_table ORDER BY order_by_field Don’t forget to include the final ORDER BY clause if you want your results returned in the sequence.
